entry.title: Ambassador Nina Hachigian talks US local diplomacy and supporting democracies

media:group.media:title: Ambassador Nina Hachigian talks US local diplomacy and supporting democracies
media:group.media:description:
Ambassador Nina Hachigian, U.S. Special Representative for City and State Diplomacy, sits down with CivilNet‚Äôs Mark Dovich to talk about the State Department‚Äôs engagement with local officials around the world, including new efforts in Armenia. They also discuss the state of relations between Washington and Yerevan more broadly, as well as what it means personally for Armenian Americans like Ambassador Hachigian to work on these issues.
0:00 ‚ÄòSubnational diplomacy‚Äô at the State Department 2:46 Connecting U.S. and Armenian local officials 5:17 ‚ÄòDigital lessons‚Äô from Los Angeles for Yerevan 7:22 Continuity of U.S. foreign policy on Armenia 9:03 What is the new Local Democracy Forum? 12:40 Representing the U.S. in Armenia as a diasporan

media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia hit back at criticism from Azerbaijan over Yerevan‚Äôs latest arms deal with France, warning Baku‚Äôs reaction suggests ‚ÄúAzerbaijan will do everything to disrupt the peace process‚Äù and ‚Äúlaunch a new aggression against Armenia.‚Äù üìç Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan and Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoƒüa said they are willing to normalize relations ‚Äúwithout preconditions‚Äù in a rare phone call. üìç Armenian purchase of French artillery system a ‚Äònew important milestone‚Äô: https://shorturl.at/kgHal üìç ‚ÄòBeing the change you want to see‚Äô with the Armenian Volunteer Corps: https://shorturl.at/MtA8D

entry.title: Up to Armenia to decide to leave Russian military alliance, Washington says

media:group.media:title: Up to Armenia to decide to leave Russian military alliance, Washington says
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia signed a contract to purchase offensive CAESAR artillery systems from France in a "new important milestone." üìç The US considers its strategic partnership with Armenia to be very important and wants to have a clear road map on how it can make progress with Yerevan in key areas. üìç Archbishop Bagrat Galstanyan pledged to continue demonstrations amid setback failure to hold a vote of no confidence against Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan. üìç The Armenian Parliament will debate on Friday holding a referendum for applying to join the European Union. üìç Business Weekly: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oCm3mK7V_nY

entry.title: ‚ÄòBeing the change you want to see‚Äô with the Armenian Volunteer Corps

media:group.media:title: ‚ÄòBeing the change you want to see‚Äô with the Armenian Volunteer Corps
media:group.media:description:
The Armenian Volunteer Corps provides service-oriented experiences in Armenia for both older diasporans and non-Armenians alike. Executive Director Arina Zohrabian joins CivilNet to share their stories of impact. They discuss how a culture of volunteerism has changed the country and how life-changing links are forged in the process.
